instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..
definitions.820-01814: What is 820-01814? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
threads.message:
Hello, I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> that has no power. It only pulls 5V from charger.
On <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS</SIGNAL> it only has 5V on F3000.
Can you help me?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
threads.message:
Do you get 5V on all ports?
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is first voltage to get on T2 boards.
Check for short, or low value in diode mode.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
threads.message:
Hi,
yes, i do have 5V on all ports, and  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  = 0V, and it's shorted (0.0029V in diode mode)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
threads.message:
Switch to ohm mode and compare reading with the values on all big coils.

Do NOT inject voltage yet!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
threads.message:
Hi, Thanks.

All big coils seams to have the right values. Shell i inject voltage to see what gest's hot?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
threads.message: Post exact ohm value to ground (not diode mode) on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> first.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> has 1.55 ohm to ground.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
threads.message: And CPU coils are not close to that ohm value???

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
threads.message:
Sorry, they are.
They're 2 ohm to ground

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
threads.message:
Unfortunatelly, you didn't bother to specify which coils exactly.
Supposing the problem is on VCORE, remove <CHIP>U7410</CHIP>/20/30 one by one and check when the short disappears from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
If still there, your problem is on iGPU coils; do the same there, if needed.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
threads.message:
Sorry, it was not my intention to ignore your request
They are all the same:
LA430 = 1.37 ohm on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_PH3</SIGNAL>
LA640 = 1.35 ohm on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_PH2</SIGNAL>
LA650 = 1.36 ohm on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_PH1</SIGNAL>


L7231 = 2 ohm
L7221 = 2 ohm
L7211 = 2 ohm
L7330 = 24 ohm
L7420 = 5.5 ohm
L7410 = 5.5 ohm
LA300 = 174 ohm
LA350 = 28 ohm

Shel i  remove <CHIP>U7410</CHIP>/20/30 ?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
threads.message:
NO, as you have 5 ohm there.
<CHIP>U7210</CHIP>/20/30 must be checked.

My mistake in previous post; typed 74 instead of 72...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
threads.message: I don't get any voltages on <CHIP>U7210</CHIP>. Should i remove it?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
threads.message:
You said to have short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Did you apply power on the board again in this condition???

I said to remove chips one by one, and check every time resistance to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
threads.message:
Sorry, i miss understood.
I' going to do as you said.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
threads.message: Hi, i've removed <CHIP>U7210</CHIP>/20/30 and the short persist on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> (1.60 ohm to ground)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
threads.message: Now try removing the chips corresponding to <SIGNAL>VCORE_S0_GFX</SIGNAL> lines (one by one).

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
threads.message: Sorry, but by chips you're meaning QA340/640/650, or the UA340 / UA600?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
threads.message:
"LA430 = 1.37 ohm on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_PH3</SIGNAL>
LA640 = 1.35 ohm on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_PH2</SIGNAL>
LA650 = 1.36 ohm on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_PH1</SIGNAL>"
Check associated chips...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
threads.message:
Hi, i´m a newbie on this, so i ask you to be patient with me :) 
I've removed the QA340, but still have 1.22 ohm on LA340, and don't know to go from here.
i suppose that, if all 3 phases are shorted, they should have a common point between all of them that is causing the short, but i can't find it. Am i rigth?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
threads.message:
I said to check when the short disappears from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>!!!
You will always have very low values on these coils as normal.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
threads.message:
Thanks. We made it :-)
It was a cap on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_SSD0_SNS</SIGNAL>
Thank you.
